sub_title: International Film & TV maker/lecturer; Free Press Unlimited; Children in the Centre foundation; @Netherlands1974 • Bloemendaal-Buenos Aires
summary: Specialties: Creative development and direction of film, television and crossmedia/transmedia projects, international coproductions, children's media and sports.

profile_positions.description:
www.imdb.com/name/nm1113579

Currently Jan-Willem Bult is series editor/coproducer of the international shortfilm fiction series 'The Day I Became Strong' (aka ‘Strong Stories’) with films in a.o. Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Colombia, Cuba, Ecuador, Germany, Mongolia, Namibia, Norway, Taiwan, Uruguay. starkegeschichten.de

Jan-Willem Bult works/worked as a media developer for various UNICEF offices, such as UNICEF Montenegro, UNICEF HQ New York, UNICEF Kyrgyzstan, UNICEF Tajikistan.

On 11 June 2020 Jan-Willem Bult directed the Prix Jeunesse International 2020 live awards TV show in Munich, Germany.
The show of the bi-annual ‘Oscars of KidsTV’ was watched in 100 countries worldwide.

Jan-Willem Bult is also creating and directing film/tv productions in Argentina with Aldana Duhalde, such as documentary 'Puertas Adentro' (2017), ‘Abrazar la ecología (2021), int. series 'Toque Cultural' (2016 ongoing).

For ‘Sam Sam’ he is producing and directing short educational documentaries: ‘Gerónimo does ballet in Argentina’, ‘Maism goes to Radio Dabanga’, ‘Felipe, the avocado’s in Chile and climate change’.

With United Way the Netherlands he produced and directed short documentary ‘Joining Forces’ (2022) and ‘Healing the Mind’ (2023).

With Child & Youth Finance International he produced and directed 4 short documentaries about young entrepreneurs: in Kenya, Uganda, Ghana, Egypt.

With One Family Foundation he made the campaign video ‘Spreek Nederlands met me’.

Since 2019 he makes podcasts on soundtracks ‘Nacht van de Filmmuziek’ / ‘Night of the Filmmusic’, a follow-up on national NPO Radio 1 shows that he made between 2010-2013 for KRO Netherlands Public Broadcasting.

After leaving public tv in 2014, Jan-Willem Bult started a media investment company. 
He was already an investor in a.o. shortfilm 'Daan Durft' (Go Daan Go! - IJswater Films), animated feature film 'Trippel Trappel (IL Luster Productions)' and animated short film ‘The Smile’ (Erik van Schaaik Productions).
profile_positions.title: Director, Writer, Producer

profile_positions.description:
Jan-Willem is leading and developing media projects for children and youth of Dutch NGO Free Press Unlimited. The projects cover media for change productions for TV, radio, online, mobile. freepressunlimited.org

Jan-Willem is the Chief Editor of WADADA News for children or youth, an international crossmedia cooperation established in already 21 countries worldwide: Argentina, Bangladesh, Bolivia, Brazil, Colombia, Ecuador, Egypt, Ghana,  Indonesia, Montenegro, Myanmar, Nepal, Netherlands, Nicaragua, México, Peru, Sierra Leone, South Africa, Ukraine, Zambia.
WADADA News specials are produced at the Amsterdam headquarters. They are distributed inside the WADADA News network. wadadanewsforkids.org

When the coronavirus outbreak started worldwide March 2020, the YouTube channel ‘My #QuarantineLife’ was opened to give children and youth worldwide a platform to share their news, opinions, stories and ideas from quarantine. youtube.com/myquarantinelife

A follow up of this project started by the end of 2021: #MyCovidStory.
In cooperation with UNICEF C4D and local partners in México, Ecuador, Ukraine, South Africa. youtube.com/wadadanews

Since 2015 Bult also started to produce youthdocumentaries at Free Press Unlimited such as ‘Kunumi, The Native Thunder’ and ‘Respect’ (both in Latin America) and produce and direct short documentaries such as ‘Ifrah Arab, Kenya’ and ‘Wilson Amooro, Ghana’ (both in Africa). https://social.yecommunity.com/news/390425

For other FPU projects and teams, Jan-Willem Bult is also working as a videomaker (director, editor, producer) and media developer.
One of the video productions that he has co-developed and is directing is ‘Studio Free Press Matters’, a talkshow about press freedom and journalism. youtube.com/freepressunlimited
He also co-developed the format for a youth led news program in Tunisia ‘Jaridaty’ and trained and supports young news makers in 6 different regions of the country. jaridaty.net
profile_positions.title: Head of Children, Youth & Media / Videomaker, media developer

profile_positions.description:
The Children in the Centre foundation (aka JWBfoundation) makes personal contributions to support children's media and sports for development and peace building projects, and those activities that are not eligible for full subsidies from public funds or organisations. The emphasis is on urgency and quality.

The Children in the Centre foundation has a special focus on Latin America with projects in Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Cuba, Colombia, Ecuador, El Salvador, México, Suriname, Uruguay and had also projects in Germany, Italy, Kyrgyzstan, Mongolia, Namibia, Slovenia, South Africa, Switzerland, Montenegro, Taiwan, Tajikistan, Turkey, Ukraine.

Jan-Willem Bult has been a guest lecturer at a.o. Universities in Buenos Aires, Bogotá, Calí, Quito, Roma, Santiago de Chile, São Paulo, Tel Aviv and a moderator at international festivals and conferences a.o. NHK Japan Prize, BBC Children's Global Media Summit, BaKaFORUM.

Bult his media work already stretches over 65 countries worldwide.
janwillembult.wix.com/childreninthecentre
www.facebook.com/ChildrenInTheCentre
profile_positions.title: Director / Founder

profile_positions.description:
The Eurovision Children's and Youth TV Experts Group connects over 30 European pubcasters and develops co-productions, exchanges, debates etc. The group is headed by a presidency that is democratically elected by the Eurovision members and appointed for a period of 2 years.
Jan-Willem Bult was already a vice-president from 2011-2013.

And from May 2001-December 2013 Jan-Willem Bult was also Co-Chair of the EBU Eurovision item exchange. Co-chairing the annual meeting in May in Erfurt (before: Saarbrücken) where some 200-300 preschool items are exchanged between 40-60 countries in 4 continents; co-ordinating and developing the Latin American exchange organized by ALA (Alianza Latino Americana).
profile_positions.title: President EBU Eurovision Children & Youth Experts

profile_positions.description:
www.imdb.com/name/nm1113579

KRO (since 2014 merged with NCRV) is part of Netherlands Public Broadcasting group.
Annually KRO Youth applied over 600 hours of tv to the national children's channel Zapp(-elin).
KRO Youth also ran a 24/7 digital preschool channel, available as online web-tv channel or via app KRO Kindertijd TV. 

Jan-Willem Bult created and produced over 125 films, programs and series and dozens of (international) coproductions for TV and cinema. He was the founder of KRO Kindertijd (preschool), creator of crossmedia/transmedia projects such as DropZone, Energy Survival, creator of formats such as preschool.doc®, Uit-me-kaar (Toolbox Kids), Groeien (Growing), FilmHit and creator of fiction series such as Adriaan, Sien van Sellingen. 

Writer of shortfilm stories such as First Child On The Moon, Genji, Joey's First Fight, Go Daan Go! and 6 Tips On How To Become The Best Football Player Of The World.

(Co-)producer of feature films and shortfilms for children and family. 

Creative producer of youthdocumentaries.
profile_positions.title: Creative Head KRO Youth / Head of Dept. / Chief Editor

profile_positions.description:
Founder and coordinator of one the national digital preschool and family channel Zappelin 24/Familie 24. One of the digital channels of Nederland24 by Netherlands Public Broadcasting.
In 2010 the public digital channels were restructured by NPO and the name changed into Zapp/Zappelin24
profile_positions.title: Channel manager of Zappelin 24/Familie 24

profile_positions.description:
Since 2011 Jan-Willem Bult presented music from soundtracks in various KRO Netherlands Public Broadcasting radioprograms.
In 2012 he developed and presented with Martijn Grimmius KRO's Nacht van de Filmmuziek, a four hours live radio format that introduced in the Netherlands the Top 40 of Best Soundtracks of All Time.
https://www.facebook.com/events/332919260127743
profile_positions.title: Presenter at Radio 1

profile_positions.description:
Jan-Willem Bult has been developing and producing programs for RKK such as 'RKK Cinema', 'Laura & Anne 4 Ever' (youthdocumentary), 'The Bureau of Big Questions', 'Patrick's Kingdom' (shortfilm), '2Brothers' (youthdocumentary), 'Christmas with the Sand Magician'.
RKK is the catholic broadcaster within the Netherlands Public Broadcasting.
profile_positions.title: Creative Producer of children & youth programs

profile_positions.description: Advising and supporting the content and organisation of the annual conference and festival on educational and societal media.
profile_positions.title: Program Committee

profile_positions.description: Anchor of the 4 hours live radio broadcast 'Sport op Zaterdag' (Saturday Sports) of local radio station Haarlem 105. Presenting and commenting regional, national and international sports matches and events that took place during the radio show. Introducing the radio reporters on site and interviewing sportsmen and women, coaches, media people working in the field etc.
profile_positions.title: Presenter at Radio Haarlem 105

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for programming strategy and programming development, scheduling, creation, production and acquisition of all programs.
KinderNet was a private children's channel in the Netherlands in the nineties and early 2000.
It was owned 66% by Kindernet and 33% by Flextech.
After that it was taken over by Nickelodeon Netherlands and disappeared as a separate brand in 2003.
profile_positions.title: Program director
